Key Match Events: Taylor Ward homered in his third straight game
Niko Kavadas also went deep in the long-struggling Angels' second victory over the major league-leading Dodgers in their last 14 meetings
Andy Pages finally chased Canning with an RBI single in the seventh, driving in his first run in nearly three weeks
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts sounded disappointed in the Dodgers' young right-hander, Bobby Miller, although he said Miller will start again next week
Manager Ron Washington said Canning was outstanding, yielding four hits and four walks while striking out seven and holding the Dodgers scoreless until the seventh
Miscellaneous Highlights: Angel Stadium was sold out for the second straight night, giving the Halos five sellouts this season
The Dodgers pulled Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman, Teoscar Hernández and Miguel Rojas in the late innings, giving them a few extra innings of rest ahead of Thursday’s day off
Others: The Angels' first five batters reached base and scored
Ward connected for his 21st homer of the season in the fifth inning, putting the Angels up 7-0 while extending his hitting streak to a career-best and current AL-best 14 games
